timeline.bodyText: Do we actually need findRandomOpenPortInRange method? It seems findRandomOpenPort() could be ok.
timeline.author: olukas

replies.bodyText: My reasoning was to use this ranged method in situations when we don't immediately occupy the free port we detect. Maybe in these situations, being on a machine with lots of activity, the port gets occupied before we attempt to do so ourselves. Whereas if you use a specific range the likelihood of this happening seems smaller. I might be completely off though, this might not match how the OS actually allocates ports. On the other hand: do we really gain anything by removing it?
replies.author: jbartok

replies.bodyText: Let's keep it as it is. You're right that we do not gain anything by removing it.
